msIdentifier.institution: Royal Asiatic Society of Great Britain and Ireland

msItem.title: A devotional poem (8ff) followed by passages selected from the Mathnawi.
msItem.note: On back cover: Book of Hindustani poetry - found in Goozerat 0n the 22nd of February 1849 - the day after the great action at that place E?D.E? Money. Inside front cover of the outer casing, pasted slip: Presented by E. Baverstock Esq to the Library of the Royal Asiatic Society through W?S? Arbuthnot. The first poem ends with a kind of dedication to a Muhammad Shah. Ruled margins. Headings and some punctuation in red.
msItem.incipit: Incipit (a): Chashm bigshay jilwah-i dildar Incipit (b): Hamd-i mahmudi kih dar jumlah suwar

layoutDesc.p: 13 lines in double column on a page

bindingDesc.p: Inner simple leather and board binding, stuck into an English red cloth casing, now separated. The casing has the title etc tooled in English on the back (or front) and spine.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
